clinical_study.brief_title: Text Message Quit Vaping Intervention for Young Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Trial of a Text Message Quit Vaping Intervention for Young Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This research study, conducted by Truth Initiative, will help us learn how text messaging can help young adults between 18 and 24 years of age quit vaping.

detailed_description.textblock: The Quit Vaping Study (QVS)'s primary aim is to conduct a fully powered comparative effectiveness trial to evaluate the effectiveness of a quit vaping text message program in promoting abstinence from e-cigarettes among young users aged 18-24. This study is a 2-arm randomized controlled trial conducted among young users aged 18-24 recruited through online channels. Participants will be randomized to a quit vaping text message intervention or to an assessment-only control condition and followed for 7 months to roughly correspond to 6-months post-treatment. The secondary aim is to examine potential mediators of program effectiveness, including treatment engagement and changes in self-efficacy and perceived social support for quitting.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Arm 1: Intervention - Text message intervention Arm 2: Control - Assessment only
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants are not explicitly told they are in the control group, although they may deduce their assignment from presence or lack of regular text message intervention.

primary_outcome.description: In the past 30 days, did you vape at all, even a puff of someone else's?

secondary_outcome.description: In the past 30 days, did you vape at all, even a puff of someone else's?
Since you joined the study a month ago/In the last 6 months, how many times have you stopped vaping - not even a puff - for one day or longer because you were trying to quit for good?
How many days per week do you vape? On average, how many puffs/hits on your vape do you take on a typical day?

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in confidence in quitting e-cigarettes
secondary_outcome.description: How confident are you that you can quit vaping? Response on a scale of 1-10

arm_group.description: Participants will be enrolled to receive messages from This is Quitting. Users receive one age-appropriate message per day tailored to their enrollment date or quit date, which can be set and reset via text message. Those not ready to quit receive 4 weeks of messages focused on building skills and confidence. Users who set a quit date receive messages for a week preceding it and 8 weeks afterward that include encouragement and support, skill- and self-efficacy building exercises, coping strategies, and information about the risks of vaping, benefits of quitting, and cutting down to quit. Keywords COPE, STRESS, SLIP, and MORE provide on-demand support.

After an initial enrollment message, participants will be contacted periodically to assess e-cigarette use. At the end of the intervention period, they will receive information on how to sign up for This is Quitting if they are interested in the program

intervention.description: Text message-based intervention for quit vaping support.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-24
- Past 30-day use of e-cigarettes containing nicotine
- Interest in quitting e-cigarette use in the next 30 days
- US residence
Exclusion Criteria:
- Failure to confirm mobile number after initial sign-up
